bullets.text: Fed approved Fulton Financial Corporation application, signaling continued regulatory clearance for banking structure/ownership changes.
Fed to hold hybrid EGRPRA outreach meeting March 26, advancing potential regulatory streamlining for banks and supervision burden reduction.
Trump weighing Iran strikes within 10 days; heightened Middle East risk premium pushed oil prices higher and weighed on global equities.
U.S. seeks “deal” pressure on Iran as Russia-Iran naval drills proceed, underscoring tighter security alignment and increased regional escalation risk.
Trump pursuing major commercial openings with Russia, potentially reshaping sanctions posture and Western geopolitical alignment if rapprochement deepens.
U.S. trade deficit totaled $901B in 2025, little changed despite tariffs—suggesting limited near-term impact on aggregate import demand and supply chains.
Japan core inflation fell below BOJ’s 2% target for first time since 2022, strengthening the case for policy patience and yen-rate volatility.
Blue Owl’s moves stoked new worries about private credit risk and liquidity, highlighting fragility concerns in fast-growing nonbank lending markets.
Amazon surpassed Walmart in annual revenue for the first time, underscoring scale advantages and intensifying AI-driven investment competition in retail and cloud.
Nvidia reportedly in talks to invest up to $30B in OpenAI, signaling AI compute/platform consolidation and escalating capital intensity in frontier-model development.
OpenAI reportedly finalizing a $100B deal at >$850B valuation, highlighting continued mega-funding for AI despite scrutiny over profitability and concentration risk.
New research suggests an AI-designed path to replace rare-earth magnets in EVs, potentially reducing supply-chain exposure to concentrated mining and processing.
Sodium-ion battery claims higher energy storage plus seawater desalination functionality, pointing to cheaper, resource-flexible storage options for grids and industry.
Reports warn U.S. science funding cuts are driving brain drain, risking long-run innovation capacity and competitiveness in strategic technologies.
